snippet: James R. Clapper Jr. said the North was disappointed he had not come bearing a “breakthrough” in relations, and he had not been certain Kenneth Bae and Matthew Todd Miller would be freed until hours before they left North Korea.
abstract: Director of National Intelligence James R Clapper Jr says about his mission to North Korea to seek release of Americans Kenneth Bae and Matthew Todd Miller that leaders were disappointed he had not come bearing a 'breakthrough' in relations; says he had not been certain they would be freed until hours before they left the country.
lead_paragraph: James R. Clapper Jr. said the North was disappointed he had not come bearing a “breakthrough” in relations, and he had not been certain Kenneth Bae and Matthew Todd Miller would be freed until hours before they left North Korea.

headline.main: U.S. Intelligence Chief Describes Mission to Free Detainees in North Korea
headline.print_headline: North Korea Sought More in Release of Prisoners
